page.title: 10Farming - Castle Kennedy
page.content: This is essentially a dairy farming district.The herds are either pure Ayrshires- dehorned and brown and white - or now more usually Ayrshire/ Friesian crosses more often black and white.Herds are 100-200 milking cows and followers(young stock). Milk production is modern and mechanised with milking parlours. Milk is piped to refridgerated tanks and then it is collected daily by bulk tankers and taken to the Galloway Creamery in Stranraer for processing and liquid milk sales. The land is farmed to produce cattle feed, mainly grass for grazing. Silage is very common but hay is less so now due to the wet climate. Some barley is grown whereas oats were the usual cereal crop fifty years ago. Straw is used for bedding animals. Turnips and peas are for cattle food. Main crop potatoes are a cash crop.
